channel.title: Compiler 508
channel.description: Where is the compiler in a 508 server??

item.title: Compiler 508
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:3, topic:239692”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=315984.msg2509839#msg2509839 date=1225227516]
… In the cmd folder…
[/quote]
Actually, you’re correct.
however, 508’s are somewhat difficult and can cause many complications in it’s creating process.
the cmd’s in 508’s aren’t batch files, but yet command Scripts. Look fo rthe very first one title’d “All”. That is you’re working command script for 508 compiling.[/quote]Obviously I’m correct. And yes, they actually are batch files hence them ending in the filename .bat and running in ms-dos… Batch is a scripting language, but simple batch files that access directories and run things aren’t “enough” to be considered scripts, and hence, are called batch files, although some large batch “scripts” are also called batch files. Please don’t try and act smart.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler 508
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

bigh51:

… In the cmd folder…

Actually, you’re correct.
however, 508’s are somewhat difficult and can cause many complications in it’s creating process.
the cmd’s in 508’s aren’t batch files, but yet command Scripts. Look fo rthe very first one title’d “All”. That is you’re working command script for 508 compiling.

Read full topic
